meanings.definition: The stomach or belly of a vertebrate animal.
meanings.sent1: The lion's gaster was full after a big meal.
meanings.sent2: She rubbed her gaster after eating a delicious meal.
meanings.sent3: The gaster of the bear growled in hunger.
meanings.sent4: His gaster was a bottomless pit when it came to desserts.
meanings.sent5: The gaster of the whale can hold tons of food at once.

meanings.definition: The enlarged posterior part of the body in certain insects and arachnids.
meanings.sent1: The spider's gaster was round and shiny.
meanings.sent2: The bee's gaster was striped and vibrant.
meanings.sent3: The ant's gaster wiggled as it scurried along.
meanings.sent4: Her gaster felt heavy with the weight of the nectar.
meanings.sent5: The gaster of the beetle was a perfect target for predators.

meanings.definition: A cavity in certain protozoans that serves as a stomach.
meanings.sent1: The tiny organism's gaster digested its food efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Under the microscope, the gaster of the protozoan was visible.
meanings.sent3: The gaster of the amoeba was the envy of its microscopic friends.
meanings.sent4: The gaster of the paramecium was a bustling hub of activity.
meanings.sent5: The gaster of the single-celled creature was its powerhouse for survival.
